s2d.input

Class Mouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • s2d.input.Mouse

  • public class Mouse
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple and easy method of tracking and reading mouse info. It is integrated into the Display.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Sina Ghaffari

      Mouse()

      The amount that the Y coordinate changed since the last poll.

      Determines whether or not the given mouse button was clicked.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mouse

        public Mouse()

    • Method Detail

      • attachMouse

        public static void attachMouse(java.awt.Component parent)
        Attaches the mouse to the given component to receive input. Must be done before the mouse will work.
        Parameters:
        parent - The component that handles mouse input.

      • updateMouse

        public static void updateMouse()
        Polls all mouse events that happened since the last poll and makes them available to the get methods.

      • setMouse

        public static void setMouse(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Sets mouse events to be polled. Should be called from every java mouse method.
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent that should be used to poll.

      • setMouse

        public static void setMouse(java.awt.event.MouseWheelEvent e)
        Sets mouse wheel events to be polled. Should be called from every java mouse wheel method.
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseWheelEvent that should be used to poll.

      • isButtonDown

        public static boolean isButtonDown(int i)
        Determines whether or not the given mouse button is down.
        Button 0 - Left Mouse Button
        Button 1 - Middle Mouse Button
        Button 2 - Right Mouse Button
        Parameters:
        i - The mouse button that should be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse button is down.

      • isButtonClicked

        public static boolean isButtonClicked(int i)
        Determines whether or not the given mouse button was clicked.
        This method will only return true for the first update that the mouse was pressed and will return false for all other updates until the button is released and re-pressed.
        Button 0 - Left Mouse Button
        Button 1 - Middle Mouse Button
        Button 2 - Right Mouse Button
        Parameters:
        i - The mouse button that should be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse button was clicked.

      • isButtonReleased

        public static boolean isButtonReleased(int i)
        Determines whether or not the given mouse button was released.
        Will only return true for the first update after being released.
        Button 0 - Left Mouse Button
        Button 1 - Middle Mouse Button
        Button 2 - Right Mouse Button
        Parameters:
        i - The mouse button that should be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse button was clicked.

      • getX

        public static int getX()
        Get the current X coordinate of the mouse as it was at the last poll.
        Returns:
        The X coordinate of the mouse relative to the top left of the display.

      • getX

        public static double getX(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform af)
                   throws java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        Applies an AffineTransform to the X coordinate of the mouse.
        This is useful when are scaling and translating a graphics object but want the mouse input to stay accurate.
        Note: This does NOT permanently change the mouse coordinate.
        Parameters:
        af - The AffineTransform that will be applied.
        Returns:
        The translated Mouse coordinate as a double.
        Throws:
        java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        See Also:
        AffineTransform

      • getY

        public static int getY()
        Get the current Y coordinate of the mouse as it was at the last poll.
        Returns:
        The Y coordinate of the mouse relative to the top left of the display.

      • getXOnScreen

        public static int getXOnScreen()
        Get the current X coordinate of the mouse on screen as it was at the last poll.
        Returns:
        The X coordinate of the mouse relative to the top left of the screen.

      • getYOnScreen

        public static int getYOnScreen()
        Get the current Y coordinate of the mouse on screen as it was at the last poll.
        Returns:
        The Y coordinate of the mouse relative to the top left of the screen.

      • getY

        public static double getY(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transformation)
                   throws java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        Applies an AffineTransform to the Y coordinate of the mouse.
        This is useful when are scaling and translating a graphics object but want the mouse input to stay accurate.
        Note: This does NOT permanently change the mouse coordinate.
        Parameters:
        transformation - The AffineTransform that will be applied.
        Returns:
        The translated Mouse coordinate as a double.
        Throws:
        java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        See Also:
        AffineTransform

      • getDX

        public static int getDX()
        The amount that the X coordinate changed since the last poll.
        Returns:
        The change in the X coordinate since the last poll.

      • getDY

        public static int getDY()
        The amount that the Y coordinate changed since the last poll.
        Returns:
        The change in the Y coordinate since the last poll.

      • getDWheel

        public static double getDWheel()
        The number of clicks that the mouse wheel has turned since the last poll.
        Returns:
        The number of clicks that the mouse wheel has turned. Negative if the mouse wheel was turned away from the user.

      • isOnScreen

        public static boolean isOnScreen()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the mouse is currently on the bounds of the parent screen.
